section.title: BatteryChemistry_enum

para.para: Enum for representing signal values for the BatteryChemistry signal.

section.para: This enum maps each value in the signal's value table to a corresponding identifier. It is used to interpret the raw data received from the CAN bus and provides human-readable names for each value.

note.title: Note
note.para: Ensure the signal values are aligned with the data type and expected range of the signal.

section.title: CreateTable_Battery_Messages()

para.para: Creates the signal table for the specified CAN message.

section.para: This function initializes the signal table for the given CAN message. It organizes and prepares the signals in the message to be ready for processing or encoding.

Parameters
indbc
Pointer to the DbcStruct instance that contains the CAN message.
Creates the signal table for the specified CAN message.

This function is used to read CAN data and store it in the DbcStruct. It parses the data and converts physical values to raw CAN signal values based on the scaling factors and offsets defined in the DbcStruct.

Parameters
inrx_data
Pointer to the received CAN data to be parsed.
inid
CAN message ID for identifying which message to parse.
in,outdbc
Pointer to the DbcStruct where parsed data will be stored.
Creates the signal table for a specified CAN message in the DbcStruct.
This function initializes the signal table for a specific message within the DbcStruct. Each signal is set to 0 initially, preparing it for further use.

entry.para: Pointer to the DbcStruct containing the CAN message and signals.

section.title: D2cc_Lib_Init()

para.para: Initializes the DbcStruct for CAN message processing.

section.para: This function should be called before using the DbcStruct to ensure that all message structures are properly initialized. It sets up necessary memory and configurations.

Parameters
inst
Pointer to the DbcStruct instance that will be initialized.
Initializes the DbcStruct for CAN message processing.
This function initializes the necessary fields in the DbcStruct based on the provided DBC messages. The signals' physical factors and offsets are set accordingly.

entry.para: Pointer to the DbcStruct instance to be initialized.

section.title: PHYS_TO_RAW()

para.para: Converts a physical value to its corresponding raw CAN value.

section.para: This function takes a physical value and applies the scaling factor and offset specified in the Phys_Value_t structure to convert it to the raw CAN signal value. The raw value can then be transmitted in a CAN message.

Parameters
inphys_value
The physical value to be converted.
inphys_struct
Pointer to the Phys_Value_t structure containing scaling and offset information.
Returns
The corresponding raw CAN value.
Converts a physical value to its corresponding raw CAN value.
This function converts a physical value (e.g., temperature) into a raw CAN signal value based on the scaling factor and offset stored in the Phys_Value_t structure.

entry.para: Pointer to the Phys_Value_t structure containing scaling factor and offset.

formalpara.title: Returns
formalpara.para: The corresponding raw CAN signal value.

section.title: RAW_TO_PHYS()

para.para: Converts a raw CAN value to its corresponding physical value.

section.para: This function takes a raw CAN value and applies the scaling factor and offset specified in the Phys_Value_t structure to convert it to the physical signal value. The physical value represents the actual measured or calculated value of the signal.

Parameters
inraw_value
The raw CAN signal value to be converted.
inphys_struct
Pointer to the Phys_Value_t structure containing scaling and offset information.
Returns
The corresponding physical value.
Converts a raw CAN value to its corresponding physical value.
This function converts a raw CAN signal value to its corresponding physical value based on the scaling factor and offset stored in the Phys_Value_t structure.

entry.para: The raw CAN signal value to convert.
Pointer to the Phys_Value_t structure containing scaling factor and offset.
